pr_title: test: Add integration tests for tracker side effects

timeline.message: Use IntegrationTestBase to run tests against Postgress
Add tracker side effect converter service
Add tracker domain objects for rule-engine
Use awaitility to test side effect thread execution

timeline.bodyText: Might it be better to cast a np here and use checkNotNull, since a silent fail will mask a potential bug?
timeline.author: netroms

replies.bodyText: Is it fixed in the branch and pushed?
replies.author: larshelge

replies.bodyText: fixed in the branch but have not pushed it yet.
replies.author: zubaira

timeline.message: Fix conflict and merge with master

timeline.bodyText: What is the reason to move the @Transactional boundary "down" to the DAO class? Normally, we transactionally annotate services rather than a repository. I would suggest adding a short comment to explain the deviation from the norm.
timeline.author: luciano-fiandesio

replies.bodyText: fixed by creating a service layer class
replies.author: zubaira

timeline.bodyText: This class doesn't seem to be Spring-managed and the constructor is not used. Is it used in some other way?
timeline.author: luciano-fiandesio

replies.bodyText: Agree, this needs to be a component to have any effect.
replies.author: larshelge

replies.bodyText: Thanks Zubair. Is this fixed in the PR?
replies.author: larshelge

replies.bodyText: yes. It is fixed in this PR. Just waiting for this PR to be merged.
replies.author: zubaira

timeline.bodyText: Consider removing this annotation. The method doesn't accces the DB directly, but only through another method (getNotificationTemplate) which is already annotated with @Transactional
timeline.author: luciano-fiandesio
luciano-fiandesio

timeline.bodyText:
We standardized the usage of @Trasactional: it should be used on methods rather that at class level. I have the impression that this method does not really need this annotation, since all the methods are

read-only
calling other methods on different classes that are already annotated.

Please review the remaining methods and move the @transactional annotation only to methods where it is needed.
timeline.author: luciano-fiandesio
luciano-fiandesio
luciano-fiandesio

timeline.bodyText: 10 seconds is a bit too long for a test? Have you considered lowering to 1 or 2 secs?
timeline.author: luciano-fiandesio

replies.bodyText: 2 also sounds a bit high :-) Do we need this? I.e. is there a way to mock or handle it differently?
replies.author: larshelge

replies.bodyText: Side effects are handled asynchronously. So this is one of the ways to test thread functionality.
replies.author: zubaira

timeline.message: use Transactional annotation at class level
